messages.subject: Re: Watching the Joys of Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Dawn, that s so wonderful. I can t wait to hear more about your unschooling journey! ~ Joanne ~ Mom to Jacqueline (8), Shawna (11) & Cimion (14) Adopted into
messages.messageBody:
Dawn, that's so wonderful. I can't wait to hear more about your
unschooling journey!

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (8), Shawna (11) & Cimion (14)
Adopted into our hearts October 2003
************************************
Unschooling Voices ~ Add Your Voice
www.foreverparents.com/UnschoolingVoices.html


--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "dawnprophetess"
<dawnprophetess@...> wrote:
>
> Just want to shout at how I am enjoying watching my children. I am
a
> new unschooler and have posted once. The first thing I have done
is
> rearranged our book shelves and made nothing off limits to my
kids.
> Here are the things they have done in the last two days on their
own.
>
> Mosaic pictures from a kit
> Coloring books of Native americans
> Paper dolls of Camelot
> Made an art/history museum in their room
> Put america at war cards in chronological order
> Colored in a Medieval coloring book
> excitement of president stickers
>
> and many other things, it would be to long to list.
>
> All these items were things I was saving for some kind of study I
> was going to do. So unfortunatly they were off limits to the
girls.
> Shame on me.
>
> They are right now as we speak chasing after eachother teasing
about
> who's president sticker is the best. We are all having the time of
> our lives.
>
> Dawn
>

messages.subject: Watching the Joys of Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Just want to shout at how I am enjoying watching my children. I am a new unschooler and have posted once. The first thing I have done is rearranged our book
messages.messageBody:
Just want to shout at how I am enjoying watching my children. I am a
new unschooler and have posted once. The first thing I have done is
rearranged our book shelves and made nothing off limits to my kids.
Here are the things they have done in the last two days on their own.

Mosaic pictures from a kit
Coloring books of Native americans
Paper dolls of Camelot
Made an art/history museum in their room
Put america at war cards in chronological order
Colored in a Medieval coloring book
excitement of president stickers

and many other things, it would be to long to list.

All these items were things I was saving for some kind of study I
was going to do. So unfortunatly they were off limits to the girls.
Shame on me.

They are right now as we speak chasing after eachother teasing about
who's president sticker is the best. We are all having the time of
our lives.

Dawn
